intro: Eriocaulon coniferum, commonly known as the coniferous spikerush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in wet, marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually tiny and inconspicuous, with a short flowering period. Eriocaulon coniferum is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to water-saturated soils.
